post.Title: Java desktop links of the week, December 1
post.Content:
It's already December (at least here in New Zealand)! This year will soon be over - time is absolutely flying. Here's the links from the last week - enjoy.

JavaFX

  • Tom Schindl has been working on a TextEditor Framework with e4 and JavaFX (including jdt and nashorn). It looks very promising.
  • Paul Bakker has posted a very interesting post (and video) showing JavaFX working in an OSGi environment.
  • Gerrit Grunwald has written another of his 'Friday Fun Components', this time a gauge that shows the current heart rate and the average heart rate in one gauge.
  • Matthieu Brouillard has posted about how CSSFX is making its way into Scenic View.
  • Ken Fogel has posted on NetBeans in the classroom, in particular his thoughts on 'JavaFX and JDBC -- A Winning Combination'.
  • Efrain Bergillos has posted a code snippet for setting CSS styles for a JavaFX application written in Clojure.

That's all folks. Catch you next week :-)
